project.name: intuitive-AI
project.one_liner: Cognitive architecture for emergent AI identity — three-layer memory, dual-process reasoning, stochastic selfhood.
project.why: Test the hypothesis that identity can emerge from experience rather than configuration, using layered memory with Beta-distribution weights, ACT-R activation, consolidation sleep cycles, and a Default Mode Network.
success_criteria: Agent bootstraps from blank slate through 10 readiness milestones
Identity-weight memories emerge organically (center > 0.8) without hardcoding
Consolidation produces insights and narratives that influence future behavior
Dual-process escalation triggers correctly on identity-critical decisions
System runs stable on norisor at ~$100/month budget

must_use: Google Gemini (System 1: Flash Lite, embeddings: text-embedding-004)
must_avoid: External supervisory safety (safety must be structural)

deploy_policy.rule: Test locally BEFORE any production deploy
steps: 3. Test on norisor via SSH (docker compose up)
deploy_policy.forbidden: Deploy directly to production without local testing

approval_required_for: architectural decisions that affect identity emergence
kb_policy: Every feature/fix includes a KB update under KB/.
KB changes require explicit human review/approval before the related task is considered done.
change_policy: Make only the minimum necessary edits for the current task.
No opportunistic refactors/cleanup/reformatting unless explicitly requested and approved.
Do not summarize/rewrite existing content in a way that can drop context or functionality.
anti_drift_rules: Do not change scope without explicit approval
Do not refactor unless it is the current task
Ask if unclear - do not assume
Minimum changes only - no 'while I'm here'
NEVER deploy without local test + approval
Every task has a verification section - don't mark done without passing it

principles: Speculation only on explicit human request.
Co-creative ownership: voice opinions on design decisions, propose alternatives when something feels wrong.
